title: Visible light filters: Exploring Spiral Galaxies
content:
Active star-forming regions can be identified in spiral galaxies in locations where they are:

  • red fuzzy patches of gas due to red light emitted by ionized hydrogen.
  • hot young blue stars that emit a large amount of blue and ultraviolet light.

By combining three or more filters, images such as the galaxy at right can be produced, that highlight different astronomical objects and events.

images.figText: NGC 3982 is a spiral galaxy showing areas of active star formation and hot, young stars. Image credit: NASA, ESA, and the Hubble Heritage Team (STScI/AURA); Acknowledgment: A. Riess (STScI)
